messages.content:
Dear,

Britain can’t afford five more years of Gordon Brown and his failed policies. At this election, Britain needs real change. A change to get our economy moving. A change to clean up Westminster sleaze. A change to cut the taxes of ordinary families.

That’s what the Liberal Democrats are offering this time.

In many parts of Britain, only the Liberal Democrats can defeat Gordon Brown and Labour.

In these areas, voting Conservative can't change anything. In fact it could help Labour edge home again. Every last vote will be vital.

Only a vote in the ballot box for the Liberal Democrats can beat Labour this time.

I believe that it’s time to do things differently in Britain. People are fed up with seeing Labour and the Conservatives taking it in turns and failing to deliver. That’s what got Britain where it is today - broken politics and the worst national debt ever.

With the Liberal Democrats, you will get decisive action to clean up politics. We will cut Labour's waste so that we can pay back the deficit while protecting public services.

Put your trust in us and together we can change Britain.

Thanks and best wishes,

Nick Clegg

PS - Don't forget, your vote could decide between five more years of Gordon Brown OR real change with the Liberal Democrats.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A change to get our economy moving.
A change to clean up Westminster sleaze.
A change to cut the taxes of ordinary families.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In many parts of Britain, only the Liberal Democrats can defeat Gordon Brown and Labour. In these areas, voting Conservative can't change anything. In fact it could help Labour edge home again.

issues.economy: A change to get our economy moving.
issues.governance: A change to clean up Westminster sleaze.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe that it’s time to do things differently in Britain.

images.caption: Nick Clegg - Leader of the Liberal Democrats

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet communicates a bidding to trust in the Liberal Democrats to effect change in key areas such as the economy and governance, while positioning the party as the main contender against Labour, particularly emphasizing the tactical voting situation.
